questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding orbital anatomy?

options.label: A
options.text: The lacrimal gland fossa is located within the lateral orbital wall

options.label: B
options.text: The medial wall of the optic canal is formed by the lateral wall of the sphenoid sinus

options.label: C
options.text: The optic canal is located within the greater wing of the sphenoid bone

options.label: D
options.text: The nerve to the inferior rectus muscle travels anteriorly along the medial aspect of the muscle and innervates the muscle on its posterior surface

questions.correct_answer: B. The medial wall of the optic canal is formed by the lateral wall of the sphenoid sinus

questions.text: A 41 year old patient presented with chronic diarrhea for 3 months. A D-xylose absorption test was order to look for:

options.label: A
options.text: Carbohydrate malabsorption due to chronic pancreatitis

options.label: B
options.text: Fat malabsorption due to mucosal disease

options.label: C
options.text: Carbohydrate malabsorption due to mucosal disease

options.label: D
options.text: Fat malabsorption due to chronic pancreatitis

questions.correct_answer: C. Carbohydrate malabsorption due to mucosal disease

questions.text: Which of the following is not a common feature of severe Plasmodium falciparum malaria?
A postoperative patient, after a subtotal colectomy, has a blood phosphate level of 0.25 mmol/L. Which one of the following statements regarding intravenous phosphate is incorrect?

options.label: B
options.text: Should never be given at a rate greater than 30 mmol over 6 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Should preferentially be given via a central line

questions.text: A 45-year-old smoker, an obese patient snores loudly. In a sleep study, patients had >6 episodes of apnea per hour of sleep at night. After controlling hypertension and quitting smoking what is the next best management for improvement of symptoms of the patient
Regarding the levels of health Care, which is the correct option?

options.label: A
options.text: Primary lead = PHC, medical college Hospital

options.label: C
options.text: Primary level = District Hospital, medical college Hospital

questions.correct_answer: D. Primary level = PHC, sub centre

questions.text: A primigravid 28 year old female comes to the Gynecological OPD post delivery for your advice on contraception. She is Hypertensive and also has a history Gestational Diabetes Mellitus. WHich of the following contraceptives can be effectively used in this patient?

A 13-year-old boy presents with a 10 day history of nonproductive cough and fever. On examination,inspiratory rales at the bilateral lung bases are very distinctly heard. Which of the following is the most likely cause of pneumonia in this adolescent age group?

A 28 year old woman complains of increased vaginal discharge of 1-month duration. A cervical Pap smear is shown in the image. Superficial epithelial cells are identified with arrows. When compared to cells from the deeper intermediate layer (top), the nuclei of these superficial cells exhibit which of the following cytologic features?
Emporiatrics refers to study of:

A 37-year-old pregnant female at 42 weeks gestational age presents with pain and regular uterine contractions every 2-3 minutes. On arrival, the patient is in a lot of pain and requesting pain relief. Her cervix is 6 cm dilated. What is the most appropriate method of pain control for this patient?
Choose which one of the following is the most inappropriate statement regarding the drug description:

options.label: A
options.text: Atropine: Treatment for organophosphate poisoning which antagonizes central effects

options.label: B
options.text: Bethanechol: Resistant to hydrolysis by cholinesterase

options.label: C
options.text: Pralidoxime: Treatment for organophosphate poisoning which prevents "aging" of cholinesterase and reactivates the enzyme

options.label: D
options.text: Propranolol: Depolarizing neuromuscular blocker used in electroconvulsive therapy

questions.correct_answer: D. Propranolol: Depolarizing neuromuscular blocker used in electroconvulsive therapy

questions.text: A 30 year old taxi driver presents with visual disturbance in both temporal visual fields. His appetite is reduced and he has a 2-week history of morning headaches. Clinical examination reveals bitemporal hemianopia. Which of the following is the best diagnostic investigation?

A 45-year-old woman with known HIV infection and resistance to therapy is admitted to the hospital with 2–3 weeks of increasing dyspnea on exertion and malaise. Chest radiograph shows bilateral alveolar infiltrates and induced sputum is positive for Pneumocystis jiroveci. Which of the following clinical conditions is an indication for administration of adjunct glucocorticoids?

A boy presents with a history of multiple episodes of moderately severe epistaxis that resolve with conservative management. The most recent attack required hospital admission. He also says he has a ‘stuffy nose’ and gets mild headaches. His father says he looks ‘puffy’ during these episodes. There is no history of foreign body inhalation or nasal trauma or easy bruising. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A male patient comes to the OPD with complaints of a mass in his nose. He has had a history of chronic sinusitis for two years. Upon further examination, he had an ear infection not so long ago and is also having problems conceiving which is under evaluation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40 year old diabetic man comes to the OPD with greyish discoloration on the skin over his face, neck and hands for the past one month. This discoloration is accompanied with abdominal and joint pain sometimes. On examination, he has gynecomastia and hepatomegaly. What is the next step of management in this patient?
In the capnogram below, the segment that correlates the exhalation of alveolar gas is represented by the points:
A 54-year-old patient is implanted with an artificial cardiac pacemaker. Which of the following conductive tissues of the heart had a defective function that required the pacemaker?

An 75 year old woman presents to the hospital with confusion and pain in her back. Lab reports show: Ca: 3.1 mmol/L, alkaline phosphatase: 249IU/L, urea: 12 mmol/L, creatinine: 317 mmol/L and Hb: 10.7g/dL. Plain lumbosacral radiographs over the point tenderness of the lower vertebrae show punched-out lytic lesions. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old woman, who has had a 4-month history of left upper limb muscular fatigue, dizziness and vertigo, is diagnosed with subclavian steal syndrome. The most common cause of subclavian steal syndrome is:

options.label: A
options.text: Distal occlusion of the left subclavian artery

options.label: B
options.text: Proximal occlusion of the left subclavian artery

options.label: C
options.text: Distal occlusion of the left brachial artery

options.label: D
options.text: Proximal occlusion of the left brachial artery

questions.correct_answer: B. Proximal occlusion of the left subclavian artery

questions.text: Which of the following is caused by deficiency of Niacin?
Identify the below instrument?
All of the following statements are false about influenza except?

options.label: B
options.text: High risk age group - 1-5 years old

options.label: C
options.text: virus shedding is present before the patient presents with symptoms

questions.text: A 48 year old female comes to the OPD with abnormal vaginal bleeding which is mostly after intercourse and sometimes in between her menstrual cycles. Examination of the patient revealed a cervical lesion of 5 cm extending to the upper part of vagina and the parametrium. What is the stage of the disease?
questions.explanation:
Stage Description
I The carcinoma is strictly confined to the cervix (extension to the uterine corpus should be disregarded)
IA Invasive carcinoma that can be diagnosed only by microscopy, with maximum depth of invasion <5mma
IA1 Measured stromal invasion <3 mm in depth
IA2 Measured stromal invasion ≥3mm and <5mm in depth
IB Invasive carcinoma with measured deepest invasion ≥5mm (greater than Stage IA), lesion limited to the cervix uteri
IB1 Invasive carcinoma ≥5 mm depth of stromal invasion, and <2cm in greatest dimension
IB2 Invasive carcinoma ≥2cm and <4cm in greatest dimension
IB3 Invasive carcinoma ≥4cm in greatest dimension
II The carcinoma invades beyond the uterus, but has not extended onto the lower third of the vagina or to the pelvic wall
IIA Involvement limited to the upper two?thirds of the vagina without parametrial involvement
IIA1 Invasive carcinoma <4cm in greatest dimension
IIA2 Invasive carcinoma ≥4cm in greatest dimension
IIB With parametrial involvement but not up to the pelvic wall
III The carcinoma involves the lower third of the vagina and/or extends to the pelvic wall and/or causes hydronephrosis or non functioning kidney and/or involves pelvic and/or para?aortic lymph nodes
IIIA The carcinoma involves the lower third of the vagina, with no extension to the pelvic wall
IIIB Extension to the pelvic wall and/or hydronephrosis or non functioning kidney (unless known to be due to another cause)
IIIC Involvement of pelvic and/or para?aortic lymph nodes, irrespective of tumor size and extent (with r and p notations)c
IIIC1 Pelvic lymph node metastasis only
IIIC2 Para?aortic lymph node metastasis
IV The carcinoma has extended beyond the TRUEpelvis or has involved (biopsy proven) the mucosa of the bladder or rectum. (A bullous edema, as such, does not permit a case to be allotted to Stage IV)
IVA Spread to adjacent pelvic organs
IVB Spread to distant organs

questions.text: A 45-year-old alcoholic man is admitted to the hospital for upper gastrointestinal bleeding. Further history and physical examination reveals bleeding is from gingival membranes. He is intoxicated and complains of fatigue.He isn't on any medications. Laboratory data show platelets of 250,000, INR of 0.9. He has a diffuse hemorrhagic eruption on his legs . What is the recommended treatment for this patient’s underlying disorder?

A man presents with a 6-week history of increasing fatigue and dark-colored stools. CBC shows hemoglobin of 8.6 g/dL and microcytic, hypochromic RBCs. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals a peptic ulcer along the lesser curvature of the stomach. This patient’s anemia is most likely caused by deficiency of which of the following?

A 15-year-old boy has 3+ protein and 4+ blood with red blood cells cast on a routine screening urinalysis. On Further examination, there were two prior episodes of “brown-colored urine” concurrent with upper respiratory tract infections during the last 3 years. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Superoxide dismutase-containing bacteria:

options.label: C
options.text: Grow slowly in the presence of CO2

options.label: D
options.text: Produce hydrogen peroxide from hydrogen ion and the superoxide free radical

questions.correct_answer: D. Produce hydrogen peroxide from hydrogen ion and the superoxide free radical

questions.text: Which hormone receptor status of breast carcinoma is more likely to respond to hormonal therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: Oestrogen receptor negative and progesterone receptor negative

options.label: B
options.text: Oestrogen receptor positive and progesterone receptor positive

options.label: C
options.text: Oestrogen receptor negative and progesterone receptor positive

options.label: D
options.text: Oestrogen receptor positive and progesterone receptor negative

questions.correct_answer: B. Oestrogen receptor positive and progesterone receptor positive

questions.text: Which one of the following statements best describes the mechanism through which Fas(CD95) initiates apoptosis?

A 43-year-old G3P2 presents for a routine checkup, her last Pap smear was 5 years ago. She denies any current medical problems but had a history of gestational diabetes in her last pregnancy. She had a postpartum bilateral tubal ligation. Her menstrual cycles are regular every 28 days and last 5 days. She is sexually active in a monogamous relationship with her husband of 16 years. She states that with cough she may occasionally lose some urine; otherwise she has no complaints. On examination she weighs 90 kg and her blood pressure is 127/81 mm Hg. What are the most appropriate screening tests for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Pap smear, fasting glucose, lipid profile

options.label: C
options.text: Pap smear, fasting glucose, lipid profile, urinalysis

options.label: D
options.text: Pap smear, fasting glucose, lipid profile, mammogram, urinalysis

questions.correct_answer: D. Pap smear, fasting glucose, lipid profile, mammogram, urinalysis

questions.text: A thin, emaciated 22 year old male presents with purple plaques and nodules on his face and arms, coughing, and shortness of breath. Which one of the following types of tests would be used to diagnose his disease?

A 30 year old male patient was recently started on fluoxetine, a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor for treatment of his long standing clinical depression. After just a few days he returns to your OPD with complaints of hardly any sleep. He also says he is hyperactive, easily distracted, and appears elated. What is the next step in his management ?

options.label: D
options.text: Continuation of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor

questions.explanation:
ONE LINERS ABOUT SSRIs
Most common side effect Upper GI discomfort (Nausea)
Most common long term side effect Sexual dysfunction
Maximum anticholinergic side effects Paroxetine
Longest acting SSRI Fluoxetine
Shortest acting SSRI Fluvoxamine

questions.text: Which of the following statements are not true regarding ‘flaps’?

options.label: A
options.text: Nerves and tendons cannot be used as free, non-vascularised grafts.

options.label: B
options.text: The fibula can be used in jaw reconstruction as a free flap.

options.label: C
options.text: The jejunum is a useful means of free flap repair for esophageal defects.

options.label: D
options.text: The latissimus dorsi and transverse rectus abdominis flaps can be used as free flaps or pedicled flaps in breast reconstruction

questions.correct_answer: A. Nerves and tendons cannot be used as free, non-vascularised grafts.

questions.text: A toddler presents to her pediatrician with a new onset of bowel and bladder dysfunction and loss of the lower limb function. Her mother had not taken enough folic acid during her pregnancy. On examination, the child has protrusion of the spinal cord and meninges. Which of the following conditions is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 25-year-old woman comes to your office for evaluation of an abnormal Pap smear. The Pap smear showed a squamous abnormality suggestive of a high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HGSIL). Colposcopy confirms the presence of a cervical lesion consistent with severe cervical dysplasia (CIN III). Which of the following human papilloma virus (HPV) types is most often associated with this type of lesion?
questions.explanation:
Low Risk HPV Subtypes High Risk HPV subtypes
  • Examples include HPV Type 6,11, 42, 43 and 44.
  • These agents are associated with condylomata and low grade lesions eg CIN I
  • Examples include HPV types 16,18, 31, 33,35,39,45,51,52,56,58,59,68,73,82
  • These agents are associated with high grade lesion (CIN II, CIN III) and invasive cancers in addition to condylomata and low grade lesions

The most prevalent High Risk HPV subtypes are 16,18, 45 and 31

questions.text: Which of the following is the wrong match of the drug to its mechanism of action?

options.label: A
options.text: Midodrine → Vasopressor that activates alpha-1 receptor used in postural hypotension

options.label: B
options.text: Fenoldopam → Peripheral vasodilator that activates D1 receptor used in hypertensive crisis

options.label: C
options.text: Clonidine → Central alpha-2 and imidazoline receptor agonist used in hypertensive urgency

options.label: D
options.text: Salmeterol → Short acting Beta-2 agonist used in asthma

questions.correct_answer: D. Salmeterol → Short acting Beta-2 agonist used in asthma

questions.text: A 9-year-old boy is diagnosed with multiple sclerosis (MS). Which of the following nervous structures would most likely be affected by this disease?
Free /Residual chlorine Levels Recommended in drinking water to kill Cyclops ?

A 12 yr old male patient came to OPD with intense itching, redness and watering eyes. Upon examination cobblestone papillae are seen. This same condition seems to have happened to him the previous summer too, when the symptoms were more aggravated. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which of the following causes of scrotal swellings is painless?
questions.explanation:
Painful Hard and painless Soft
Torsion of testis Tumour Varicoele
Torsion of hydatid of Morgagni Syphilis Epididymal cyst
Epididymitis Tuberculosis Hydrocele

questions.text: A 36-year-old G1P0 woman presents for her first prenatal visit late in her first trimester of pregnancy; she complains of persistent vaginal bleeding, nausea, and pelvic pain. Physical examination is notable for a gravid uterus larger than expected for gestational age. Which of the following is most likely to be true?

options.label: A
options.text: B hCG levels will be higher than normal

options.label: B
options.text: B hCG levels will be lower than normal

options.label: C
options.text: uterus will be of normal levels

questions.correct_answer: A. B hCG levels will be higher than normal

questions.text: A 42 year old laborer visits a psychiatrist saying he has found it difficult to make it to work on time because he keeps driving back to his house to make sure that the front door is shut. He has begun waking up 2 hours early to facilitate these obsessions and compulsions. There are no additional complaints. Which of the following would be recommended for OCD?

A 34 year old woman presents with primary infertility and right sided pain in the abdomen. An HSG done shows tobacco pouch appearance of the right sided fallopian tube. Which of the following is the common mode of transmission of this condition?

A 25 year old female comes to the Dermatologist to treat severe Acne. After appropriate treatment, her acne is treated but she is left with Acne scars all over her face. These scars are hyper pigmented. Which of the following drugs may have caused this reaction?

A 8 year old boy was brought for consultation for decreased height. The levels of GH is normal. Past history of delayed milestones was reported by his parents. Range of IQ was 60 . What is the probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is true about Trachoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Is a disease of high infectivity

options.label: B
options.text: Prevalence of severe and moderate trachoma in > 1 % in children less than 10 yrs is indication for mass treatment

options.label: C
options.text: Irritants like kajal or surma also predispose

options.label: D
options.text: Is a non-avoidable cause of blindness in India

questions.correct_answer: C. Irritants like kajal or surma also predispose

questions.text: Mannitol may be useful in all the following conditions except:

options.label: C
options.text: Treatment of acute renal failure and acute pulmonary edema.

questions.correct_answer: C. Treatment of acute renal failure and acute pulmonary edema.

questions.text: A stroke patient is unable to swallow because of a nerve injury. Which of the following nerves is not affected?

inspiratory stridor is seen in all except:
questions.explanation:
Inspiratory stridor Expiratory stridor Biphasic stridor

Obstructive lesions of the supraglottis eg:

  1. Laryngomalacia
  2. Retropharyngeal abscess
  3. Acute epiglottitis

Lesions of the thoracic trachea, eg:

  1. Bronchial foreign body
  2. Tracheal stenosis

Lesions of the glottis, subglottis and the cervical trachea, eg:

  1. Laryngeal papilloma
  2. Vocal cord paralysis
  3. Subglottic stenosis

options.label: D

questions.text: A patient presented with multiple, well demarcated, finely scaling hypopigmented patches over the trunk and the back.Which of the following is not true about this condition?

questions.text: An enzyme catalyzing the reaction E + A EA → E + P was mixed with 4 mM substrate (compound A). The initial rate of product formation was 25% of Vmax. Which one of the following is the Km for the enzyme?

A 40-year-old morbidly obese woman presents to your office for evaluation of irregular, heavy menses occurring every 4 to 6 months. An endometrial biopsy shows complex hyperplasia of the endometrium without atypia. The hyperplasia is most likely related to the excess forma?on in the patient’s adipose tissue of which of the following hormones?

The family is Jewish and at the time of the boy’s circum- cision were told by their rabbi that the urethral meatus was not in the normal position. On examination, the meatus is on the ventral surface just below the glans penis. What is the most likely diagnosis?

The term end-stage renal disease (ESRD) is considered appropriate when GFR is:
questions.explanation:
CKD Stage GFR Level (mL/min/1.73m2)
G1 > 90
G2 60-89 HTN develops in this stage
G3 30-59 Anemia develops in this stage
G4 15-29 Acidosis,Hyperkalemia
G5 < 15 (End stage renal disease) Uraemia develops

Albuminuria
A1 3–30 mg/g
A2 30–300
A3 > 300

questions.text: A 30 year old lady collapsed during a Pilates class and was brought to the ER in asystole. She has no past cardiac history and has been generally fit. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her arrest?
All of the following uremic manifestations improve with dialysis except?

A 60 year old male comes to the OPD with complaints of difficulty swallowing and a dull ear ache for the past few days. He has a history of tobacco smoking for the past 30 years.The most common cause of laryngeal stridor in a 60 year old male is:
A patient with a long history of cardiovascular disease develops worsening ventricular arrhythmias. Which of the following drugs is most likely to be the cause of the arrhythmia?
Odland bodies are the processing and the repository areas of lipids that contribute to the epidermal permeability barrier. Where are these bodies found?
questions.correct_answer: A. Upper part of stratum spinosum

questions.text: A 55 year old man with a history of hypertension presents to the ER with sudden loss of vision. A fundoscopy exam was done which is shown. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Which of the following is the tapeworm acquired from eating undercooked pork?

A 35-year-old woman with diabetes mellitus and hypertension presents to the ER with seizures during week 35 of her pregnancy. Her blood pressure is 160/100 mmHg. She has 4+ proteinuria. Management should include all of the following except
Which of the following statements about endometriosis is not correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Family history is the most crucial risk factor

options.label: B
options.text: Meyer and Ivanoff put forth the theory of Embolization of menstrual fragments through vascular and lymphatic channels

options.label: C
options.text: Estrogen plays no role in the treatment of endometriosis

options.label: D
options.text: If the family is complete and the patient has severe pain or menstrual complaints: Hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo oophorectomy

questions.correct_answer: B. Meyer and Ivanoff put forth the theory of Embolization of menstrual fragments through vascular and lymphatic channels

questions.text: Immediately following a normal vaginal delivery , the baby develops diffuse swelling over the scalp which appears to be bluish-red in colour and tender to touch. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Identify the wrong match:

options.label: A
options.text: Total osmolarity of WHO Reduced Osmolarity ORS → 245 mmol/L

options.label: B
options.text: Low birth weight incidence in India → 28%

options.label: D
options.text: Dose of ORS for a child with weight 12 kg → 2000 ml

questions.correct_answer: D. Dose of ORS for a child with weight 12 kg → 2000 ml

questions.text: A 84 year old woman is brought unconscious to the emergency room from a nursing home. Her blood pressure is 70/30 mm Hg. She is febrile and tachypneic. Laboratory studies demonstrate a WBC count of 22,000/μL with 92% neutrophils. Urinalysis reveals numerous Gram-negative organisms. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

Different semi closed anesthesia ventilation also known as Mapleson Circuits.While setting up for anesthesia delivery and planning for controlled ventilation of an asthmatic patient, which of the Mapleson systems provides for the best efficacy?

A 24 year old woman complains of recurrent bone pain and increasing abdominal girth. Examination reveals massive hepatosplenomegaly and several radiolucent bone defects. A bone marrow biopsy discloses enlarged cells with a fibrillar appearance reminiscent of “wrinkled tissue paper.” Microscopic examination of a splenectomy specimen is shown. Which one of the following types of hydrolytic enzymes does the patient have a gene mutation of?
All of the following are characteristics of the Watson-Crick DNA double helix, EXCEPT?

options.label: A
options.text: The two polynucleotide chains are coiled about one another and about a common axis.

options.label: B
options.text: The sequence in one strand of the helix varies independently of that in the other strand.

options.label: C
options.text: The helix makes one complete turn every 34Å because each base pair is rotated by 36o with respect to adjacent base pairs and is separated by 3.4Å from them along the helix axis.

options.label: D
options.text: The purines and pyrimidines are on the inside of the helix and the phosphodiester- linked backbones are on the outside.

questions.correct_answer: B. The sequence in one strand of the helix varies independently of that in the other strand.

questions.text: A male presents to the ER with a fracture of his humerus after a minor fall. He has a history of multiple fractures after minor traumas. He also has “sky blue” sclera and an aortic regurgitation murmur. A mutation in which one of the following proteins can result in his condition?

A female patient with a new genital lesion presents to a STD health camp. She is homeless, has no health insurance, and is an intravenous drug user. On the suspicion of syphilis, which of these techniques would be most appropriate to demonstrate treponemes?

options.label: A
options.text: Immunological test such as the VDRL

questions.text: Which among the following is/are true about Dressler syndrome ?

options.label: B
options.text: ECG shows ST elevation with concavity downwards

questions.text: A 45 year old female patient came to the OPD with complaints of redness, itching , photophobia and decrease in vision for the past few days. She seemed to have tripped on her cat on the floor. She has 3 cats at her house and lives by herself. A fundus examination revealed the following. Which of the following may have caused this condition?
questions.explanation:
• Infections
  • toxoplasmosis
  • TB(2nd M/C/CAUSE)
  • Toxocariasis
  • CMV,HIV

Immune

Disorders

questions.text: A 25 year old man with AIDS complains of painful swallowing. Physical examination of his oral cavity demonstrates a whitish membrane covering much of his tongue and palate. Endoscopic examination reveals the same whitish membrane covering his esophageal mucosa. Which of the following is responsible for this patient’s symptoms?
Which of the following is Not true about PET scans?

options.label: A
options.text: Based on the metabolism of glucose in the cells

options.label: B
options.text: Agents commonly used include fluorine-18 (18F) fluoro-deoxyglucose (FDG), called [18F] FDG PET.

options.label: C
options.text: FDG-PET can differentiate benign from malignant lesions as small as 1 mm

options.label: D
options.text: FDG-PET is used for diagnosis, staging, and monitoring cancers

questions.correct_answer: C. FDG-PET can differentiate benign from malignant lesions as small as 1 mm

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding lymphangitis, except:

options.label: A
options.text: Lymphangitis is usually caused by Pseudomonas.

options.label: B
options.text: Lymphangitis is indicated by red streaking in the limb.

options.label: C
options.text: Lymphangitis may predispose to further attacks.

options.label: D
options.text: Lymphangitis may often result in bacteraemia.

questions.correct_answer: A. Lymphangitis is usually caused by Pseudomonas.

questions.text: A woman is admitted after a fall at home. Her leg is shortened and externally rotated. X-rays show a fracture line running through both the greater and the lesser trochanters. The appropriate management is:

A 45-year-old female presents with increased instability and incoordination. Physical examination shows nystagmus, mild dysarthria, and past-pointing on finger-to-nose testing. Serologic evaluation reveals the presence of anti-Yo antibody. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this clinical syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Non-small cell cancer of the lung

questions.text: A 8-week-old male infant is admitted to the pediatric ward with vomiting and dehydration. The parents also said that their child has been vomiting for the past 3 weeks with increasing severity and frequency. He has remained hungry, is febrile, and has no diarrhea. During the past 2 days, he has had only two wet diapers per day. Based on the most likely diagnosis, which of the following would be the most likely electrolyte pattern?

An 8 year old boy comes to the ER with sudden intense ear pain with throbbing which radiates to the temporo-mandibular joint and mastoid process. He is unable to sleep as he also has a seasonal upper respiratory tract infection and fever. Upon further examination, the following image was seen. Which is the most common causative organism for the above mentioned condition?

During a routine OB visit, a 20-year-old G1P0 patient at 22 weeks gestational age undergoes a urinalysis. The dipstick test done indicates the presence of trace glucosuria. All other parameters of the urine test are normal. Which of the following is the most likely etiology of the increased sugar detected in the urine?

options.label: B
options.text: The patient has a urine infection.

options.label: C
options.text: The patient’s urinalysis is consistent with normal pregnancy.

options.label: D
options.text: The patient has underlying renal disease.

questions.correct_answer: C. The patient’s urinalysis is consistent with normal pregnancy.

questions.text: All of the following statements are correct except:

options.label: A
options.text: Spironolactone antagonizes aldosterone receptor- decreasing synthesis of protein that stimulates Na+ pump.

options.label: B
options.text: Amiloride acts independent of aldosterone, blocking Na+ channels directly.

options.label: C
options.text: Vasodilator action of thiazides is the basis for their antihypertensive effect

options.label: D
options.text: Loop diuretics release PGs which result in vasodilation of efferent arteriole.

questions.correct_answer: D. Loop diuretics release PGs which result in vasodilation of efferent arteriole.

questions.text: The normal flora of the large intestine consists mainly of
Which Biomarker is not involved in acute kidney injury?
questions.explanation:
Marker Significance
Neutrophil gelatinase induced lipocalin
  • In the case of acute kidney injury, NGAL is secreted in high levels in the blood and urine within 2 hours of injury
  • Because NGAL is protease resistant and small, the protein is easily excreted and detected in the urine
  • NGAL levels in patients with AKI have been associated with the severity of their prognosis and can be used as a biomarker for AKI.
  • NGAL can also be used as an early diagnosis for procedures such as chronic kidney disease, contrast-induced nephropathy, and kidney transplant
Kidney injury molecule
  • In response to progressive injury, kidney cells produce the molecule, KIM-1, which maintains its expression over time in chronic kidney disease, and has been known as an early predictive molecule and a usefulbiomarker for kidney injury in preclinical trials and in patients
Micro RNA 122
  • Tumor suppressor micro-RNA that regulateintrahepatic metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma
CYSTATIN C
  • CystatinC is a member of the cystatin superfamily of cysteine protease inhibitors and is produced at a relatively constant rate from all nucleated cells. Cystatin has a low molecular weight (approximately 13.3 kilodaltons), and it is removed from the bloodstream by glomerular filtration in the kidney. If kidney function and glomerular filtration rate decline, the blood levels of cystatin C rise. Serum cystatin C has been proposed to be a more sensitive marker of early GFR decline than is plasma creatinine; however, like serum creatinine, cystatin C is influenced by age, race, and sex and is additionally associated with diabetes, smoking, and markers of inflammation

A 50-year-old woman presents with a 2-year history of upper truncal obesity and depression. Serum levels of glucose and cortisol are elevated. A CT scan of the abdomen reveals a 2-cm suprarenal mass. The surgical specimen is shown in the image. If this neoplasm is benign, which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis?

He doesn’t talk to anyone much and when addressed he answers with frustration and irritability. Upon further examination, he tells you, he’s lost his job and hence is feeling worthless and is blaming himself for all other failures in his life. options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Cerebrum has the highest number of neurons

options.text: Disease is limited to the terminal ileum and distally.

questions.correct_answer: C. Transmural involvement is seen in histology.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of the stochastic effect of radiation?

Stochastic effects Non-stochastic effects

C. Possibility of occurrence rises with a rise in dose C. Severity increases with a rise in dose
D. Non-deterministic effects D. Deterministic effects

questions.text: The exchange of homologous segments of RNA between two different influenza type A viruses is called:

A man, who works as a gym trainer, presented to the ER with a persistent deep ache in his leg after a heavy weight plate fell on his leg at work. A provisional diagnosis of compartment syndrome is made. Which of the following is not true regarding this diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: It is detected by a loss of distal pulses and sensation.

options.label: B
options.text: It produces pain out of all proportion to the injury.

options.label: C
options.text: It is more common in closed fractures than open ones.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a result of raised pressure in a compartment collapsing the veins.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is detected by a loss of distal pulses and sensation.

questions.text: A 27-year-old G1P0 presents to the obstetrician’s office at 40 weeks gestation. On physical examination, her cervix is 1 centimeter dilated, 0% effaced, firm, and posterior in position. Which of the following is the best next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Send the patient to the hospital for induction of labor

options.label: B
options.text: Order biophysical profile testing (BPP) for the same or next day.

options.label: C
options.text: Schedule the patient for induction of labor at 43 weeks gestation.

options.label: D
options.text: Schedule cesarean delivery for the following day since it is unlikely that the patient will go into labor.

questions.correct_answer: B. Order biophysical profile testing (BPP) for the same or next day.

questions.text: A patient presents with a loss of sensation to the skin over the shoulder. Injury to which of the following nerve cells would most likely affect the conduction of sensory information to the central nervous system?
According to National Health policy 2017, identify the correct match of the following goals by their target year?
Anderson's criteria are used to classify which disease in ophthalmology:
questions.explanation:
Stage 1:Early Defect ≥ -6.00 dB - a cluster of ≥ 3 points on the pattern deviation plot in an expected location of the visual field depressed below the 5% level, at least one of which is depressed below the 1% level- CPSD/PSD significant at P<00.5- GHT Outside Normal Limits
Stage 2:Moderate Defect ≥ -6.00 to -12.00 dB - ≥ 25% but <50% of points on the pattern deviation plot depressed below the 5% level, and ≥15% but <25% of points depressed below the 1% level- at least 1 point within the central 5° with sensitivity of <15 dB but no points in the central 5° with sensitivity of <0 dB- only 1 hemifield containing a point with sensitivity <15 dB within 5° of fixation
Stage 3:Advanced Defect ≥ -12.01 to -20.00 dB - ≥ 50% but <75% of points on pattern deviation plot depressed below the 5% level and ≥25% but <50% of points depressed below the 1% level- any point within the central 5° with sensitivity <0 dB- both hemifields containing a point(s) with sensitivity <15 dB within 5° of fixation

Carboprost(PGF2∝) 250 µg I.M. only
Recombinant VII 90µg/kg I.V. Infusion

questions.text: True statements regarding Crohn's disease is/ are -
questions.explanation:
Feature Crohn Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Macroscopic
Bowel region involved Any site of GIT Colon only
Distribution Skip lesions Diffuse
Stricture Yes Rare
Wall appearance Thick Thin
Microscopic
Inflammation Transmural Limited to mucosa, submucosa
Pseudopolyps may/ may not be present Markedly present
Ulcers Deep, knife-like Superficial, broad-based
Lymphoid reaction Marked Moderate
Fibrosis Marked Mild to none
Serositis Marked Mild to none
Granulomas Yes ( 35%) [non-caseating] No
Fistulae/sinuses Yes No
Clinical
Perianal fistula Yes (in colonic disease) No
Fat/vitamin malabsorption Yes No
Malignant potential With colonic involvement yes Yes
Recurrence after surgery Common No
Toxic megacolon No Yes
All features may not be present in a single case.

questions.text: In tubulo glomerular feedback, when Na is sensed by Macula densa, Na reabsorption leads to formation of ADP. Which is the most important ligand in this feedback mechanism?
questions.explanation:
BP & RPP keep fluctuating ↑ end renal blood flow

↓

↑ GFR & ↑ Na+ filtration

↓

H2O loss following Na+ loss

↓

Fluid & electrolyte imbalance

  • This is prevented by TGS

TGF

Na+ reaches early DCt

↓

Sensed by MD cell

↓

↑ ed Na+ reabsorption

↓

↑ ATPase (Na+ - K+ pump)

↓

ATP → ADP/ ↑ ed adenoosine formation (most imp. ligand in TGF)

↓

Goes to afferent arteriole

↓

↓ BF to glomerulus

↓

↓ GFR & Na+ filtration / loss

questions.text: A 60 year old man with prostate cancer and bone metastases presents with shaking chills and fever. The peripheral WBC count is 1,000/μL (normal = 4,000 to 11,000/μL). Which of the following terms best describes this hematologic finding?

A 35 year old female came to the OPD with intense pain in her left knee that increases with activity. It increases in the night. On examination there is a palpable mass with tenderness over the mass. Biopsy of the Mass was done and is given below. What is the treatment of choice in this condition?

A 32 year old man presented to the ER with complaints of “heartburn”. He is not responsive to usual medicines and undergoes an endoscopy with biopsy of the distal esophagus. What type of mucosa is normal for the distal esophagus?
In a young female of reproductive age with regular menstrual cycles of 28 days, ovulation occurs around the 14th day of periods. When is the first polar body released?
The mechanism of death in carbon monoxide (CO) poisoning is through which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: A
options.text: Displacement of oxygen on hemoglobin by CO

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of the respiratory chain enzymes

questions.correct_answer: A. Displacement of oxygen on hemoglobin by CO

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Arsenic Poisoning is Not correct :

options.label: B
options.text: Arsenic cannot be detected when the body has been burnt for a long time

options.label: C
options.text: Due to rapid distribution of arsenic in tissues, blood arsenic levels are unreliable

questions.correct_answer: C. Due to rapid distribution of arsenic in tissues, blood arsenic levels are unreliable

questions.text: Micturition is a reflex sensed by proprioceptors in the bladder wall and contraction of detrusor muscle by the pontine reflex arc. What is the physiological capacity of a human urinary bladder?
Lecture Method of teaching is a type of:

A neonate is diagnosed with congenital neonatal emphysema, which is caused by collapsed bronchi because of failure of bronchial cartilage development. Bronchial cartilages are derived from which of the following derivations?

A 25 year old is brought to the ER. His physical examination and computed tomography scan reveal a fracture of the T4 vertebrae. The fractured body of the T4 vertebra articulates with which of the following parts of the ribs?
questions.correct_answer: D. Head of the fifth rib

questions.text: ATPase pumps are primary active transport which bind and breakdown ATP and utilize ATP directly. Which type of ATPase pump works like an ATP synthase?
A man comes to the ER with a stab wound, cannot raise his arm above horizontal, and exhibits a “winged scapula.” Which of the following structures of the brachial plexus would most likely be damaged?
